definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: The person in-charge of a representative office shall be the chief representative.
sentences.chinese: 代表處主要負責人稱首席代表。

sentences.english: Interpretation is provided by OrricK Beijing Office's Chief Rep. Mr. Wang Xiang.
sentences.chinese: 王翔美國奧睿律師事務所北京辦事處首席代表。

sentences.english: Ma Xulun, the chief representative of China Association for Promoting Democracy, delivered speech in the convention.
sentences.chinese: 民進首席代表馬敘倫在大會發言。

sentences.english: But Iran’s chief negotiator, Saeed Jalili, said he would not discuss suspending uranium enrichment.
sentences.chinese: 但是伊朗首席代表賈利利表示，不會討論中止鈾濃縮。

sentences.english: Ye Myint is the regime's chief negotiator in talks with the ceasefire groups.
sentences.chinese: 葉敏是軍政府與停火談判的首席代表。

definition: head/director (of an organizational unit)/(police) commissioner/inspector-general/rank of local governor in Tang dynasty administration

pinyin: Lian2 he2 guo2 Mi4 shu1 chu4
